definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: The cold wind pierced him to the bone.
The bleak winter was over, flowers are in full blossom.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨的冬天已经过去，鲜花正竞相开放。

sentences.english: This year’s spring was quite prolonged. It’s May now but it’s still rather cold here.
sentences.chinese: 今年的寒春特别的漫长，直到五月这里仍寒风刺骨。

sentences.english: Shepperton Studios, London, on a bleak December day.
sentences.chinese: 谢伯顿制片厂，伦敦，十二月寒风刺骨的一天。

sentences.english: Put on your overcoat. The wind is thrilling.
Chilled my spine, wouldn't change my mind, I did not care.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨，这不会改变我的决心，我不在乎。

sentences.english: We felt the bite of the cold wind.
The biting winter is gone and the flowers come into blossom.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨的冬天已经过去，鲜花正竞相开放。

sentences.english: The pain of piercing winds in the streets.
The beautiful flowers are competing with each other while the piercing winter passing away.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨的冬天已经过去，鲜花正竞相开放。

sentences.english: The bleak winter is over, and flowers are full into blossom.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨的冬天已经过去，鲜花正竞相开放。

sentences.english: It was bitter coldand very windy.

definition: cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
a world of ice and snow
The north wind is icy cold.
goose feather snow (idiom)/big heavy snow fall
